plugins.name: Asterisk
plugins.description:
Asterisk creates a personal knowledge system within your Figma files. Add context to any design element with custom tags, notes, and reference links. Quickly search and navigate to specific elements, making complex files manageable. Created for designers who want to add meaningful annotations to their file with contextual search to maintain clarity and effortless navigation.


üìù Add notes and custom tags to any layer in your file

üåê Add URLs to images for instant access to their source

üîç Find any element instantly with powerful search and filter functionality

‚ö° One-click navigation to any tagged element

*Ô∏è‚É£ Personalise your experience with fully customizable display options


*Free to use while in beta ~ provide feedback for lifetime free access üíö
plugins.tagline: *Add searchable notes, tags, and links to elements to organize, explore, and navigate effortlessly

plugins.name: NornAI - Boost Your Design and Content with AI
plugins.description:
üîÆ NornAI: Harness the power of artificial intelligence to transform and adapt your texts, adjusting tone and style to create unique and engaging designs. Inspired by mythology, this plugin offers a magical and personalized experience.




‚ú® Key Features


Text transformation with predefined tones: standard, success, error, call to action, and more.

Quick suggestions to summarize, expand, simplify, and make text more persuasive or friendly.

Image search and insertion with a special themed interface.



üõ†Ô∏è How to Use


1. Text Transformation

  1. Select the desired text.
  2. Choose a voice tone or quick suggestion.
  3. Use custom prompts for specific instructions.
  4. Click on one of the generated alternatives to apply.



2. Image Search

  1. Access the "Images" tab.
  2. Enter your search and optionally select a color filter.
  3. Click on an image to insert it into the project.
plugins.tagline: Enhance your design workfklow with AI

plugins.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables
plugins.description:
GridVar helps you create width-based column layout grids with linked variables for any frame width. It automatically generates a set of variables representing different column configurations, including gutters, so you can quickly adjust and find the perfect fit for nested layers.


‚ú® Key Features:

‚Ä¢Quick Setup: Easily create layout grids with variable-based configurations.

‚Ä¢Flexible Widths: Effortlessly switch between column setups to match your design needs.

‚Ä¢Time-Saving: Eliminate manual calculations and streamline your workflow.


üìå How It Works:

Generated variables are conveniently stored in the "GridVar" variable collection. You can find the column width variables under: [Grid Name]/Columns.


Perfect for designers looking to simplify layout grid handling and enhance their Figma workflow.
plugins.tagline: GridVar: Width-based Layout Grids with Variables

plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!
plugins.tagline: Save properties of a layer and quickly apply them from the menu or using a shortcut.

plugins.name: Frame Flow
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin ‚ÄúFrame Flow‚Äù allows you to duplicate the selected frame to the right or below with a predefined spacing. In addition to duplication, it also lets you insert blank frames at custom intervals. It‚Äôs especially useful when creating presentation documents, as it helps you add pages smoothly without disrupting the layout spacing. Setting up keyboard shortcuts is highly recommended for efficient use.


New Frame

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size.


Add Frame Right

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size to the right of the currently selected frame.

Recommended shortcut: ‚åò + ‚å• (Option) + ‚Üí (Right Arrow)


Add Frame Below

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size below the currently selected frame.

Recommended shortcut: ‚åò + ‚å• (Option) + ‚Üì (Down Arrow)


Duplicate Frame Right

Duplicates the currently selected frame to the right.

Recommended shortcut: ‚åò + ‚å• (Option) + ‚áß (Shift) + ‚Üí (Right Arrow)


Duplicate Frame Below

Duplicates the currently selected frame below.

Recommended shortcut: ‚åò + ‚å• (Option) + ‚áß (Shift) + ‚Üì (Down Arrow)


Settings

Configure various parameters.

plugins.name: TextSwapper
plugins.description:
Features


Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes in Figma.

Quickly update text without needing extra tools.

Streamlined text replacement for multiple objects, components, and frames.

Simple and intuitive interface for seamless integration with your workflow.

Save time ‚è∞ and eliminate the hassle of manually editing text in Figma!

How:


Add the word "page" to the name of your page frame (e.g., agreement_page).

Enter the text you want to replace in the "Find text" field (e.g., {company name}).

Enter the new text in the "Replace with" field (e.g., Figma).

Use the "Update" button to replace the specified line, or the "Update All" button to replace all occurrences of the text in your document.

Use the + and - buttons to adjust the number of text fields.

Click Save to store your list of text replacements for faster updates when working on the same document.

Use Load to retrieve your saved list of text replacements and automatically fill in the fields. The current version retrieves only the latest saved list.

Click Download Selected Pages as PDF to download the selected pages as one merged PDF file.
plugins.tagline: Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes‚Äîno extra tools needed.

plugins.name: CopyCraft
plugins.description:
Streamline your text editing workflow with a powerful tool that helps you manage and edit text content across your Figma designs with precision and ease.

How it Works:


Text Loading:

Select any frame or text element in your Figma document and load it into the editor with a single click.


Smart Organization:

  1. Texts are automatically grouped by their parent elements (Frames, Components, or Groups)
  2. Each text element shows its character count and previous versions
  3. Intuitive interface for quick access to all text elements


Efficient Editing:

  1. Edit multiple text elements simultaneously
  2. Apply text styles directly from the editor
  3. Preview changes in real-time
  4. Navigate quickly to specific elements in your design


Key Features:

  1. Character counter for precise text control
  2. Previous version tracking for each text element
  3. Direct navigation to elements in your design
  4. Batch saving capabilities for groups of text
  5. Support for text styles application


Perfect for teams working on large-scale designs where maintaining text consistency and efficiency in editing is crucial.
plugins.tagline: Text Management Made Simple

plugins.name: Typographica
plugins.description:
Typographica helps you quickly create beautiful and balanced font combinations for any project ‚Äî from corporate dashboards to creative websites.


The plugin analyzes your chosen primary font, project style, and font metrics to generate harmonious font pairs automatically.


What does Typographica do?


  1. Generates Primary + Secondary + Accent font combinations
  2. Takes into account your project style (7 styles: business, corporate, modern, elegant, fun, personal, minimalist)
  3. Analyzes font metrics (x-height, glyph width, weight, stylistic characteristics)
  4. Automatically filters out fonts that do not fit the selected style
  5. Lets you save combinations as Figma text styles and variables
  6. Optionally adds smart descriptions to generated styles
  7. Supports manual swapping of secondary and accent fonts
  8. Works with any available fonts ‚Äî Google Fonts, local fonts, and Figma-supported fonts


Who is it for?


  1. Product designers ‚Äî to quickly build solid typography systems
  2. UX/UI designers ‚Äî to improve readability and visual rhythm
  3. Brand designers ‚Äî to find well-balanced and creative font pairs
  4. Beginners ‚Äî to get guidance on what fonts work well together
  5. Experienced designers ‚Äî to save time and explore unexpected combinations


How does it work?


  1. Choose your project style
  2. Select a Primary Font
  3. Click Change Pairs
  4. Browse the generated font pairs and accent options
  5. Save styles or variables in one click
  6. Tweak and refine as needed


Why use Typographica?


Save time ‚Äî no more manual font pairing

Get better quality ‚Äî pairs are based on font metrics and style fit, not guesswork

Flexible ‚Äî works for classic and modern designs alike

Customizable ‚Äî easy to adjust pairs or generate new ones on the fly


Styles and Tokens Support


Typographica not only generates font pairs, but also helps you create full-fledged text styles and design tokens in Figma.


You can save your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts as reusable Text Styles and optionally as Variables (Tokens) ‚Äî making your typography consistent across your project and design system.


Style Description Table


Typographica can automatically generate a style description table for your font system ‚Äî right inside Figma.


It creates a clear, editable table summarizing your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts, with suggested usage and style notes.


Perfect for documenting typography choices or sharing with your team and developers.


Typographica is your smart font pairing assistant in Figma. Make your typography cleaner, more beautiful, and more consistent ‚Äî with less effort.

This plugin lets you scale one or multiple selected icons into multiple standard sizes in a single click ‚Äî while preserving all their styles, groups, layers, strokes, and fills. No flattening. No distortion.


But that‚Äôs not all ‚Äî‚Ä®It also automatically generates a variable component for each icon, so you can easily manage different icon sizes using Figma's powerful component properties.


Whether you‚Äôre preparing icon sets for design systems, exports, or different platform needs, this plugin automates the repetitive work ‚Äî and gives you perfect consistency every time.

‚úÖ Scale multiple icons at once into multiple sizes

‚úÖ Creates a variable component with size modes for each icon

136943.description: This plugin lets you export a ready-to-send XRechnung XML invoice from a structured Figma template (https://www.figma.com/community/file/1506387895617421047/xrechnung-invoice-template-for-freelancers-germany). It's built for freelancers and creatives working with German public-sector clients who need to submit invoices via portals like ZRE, OZG-RE, or PEPPOL. Just fill in the provided template, select the invoice frame, and run the plugin. It creates a valid .xml file with one click‚Äîno coding or formatting required.
136943.tagline: Generate valid XRechnung XML invoices directly from Figma.

## Ê≥®ÊÑè‰∫ãÈ†Ö

- „Åì„ÅÆ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅØÈÅ∏ÊäûÁîªÂÉè„ÅÆÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÇíÂ§ñÈÉ®AI„Çµ„Éº„Éì„ÇπÔºàGoogle Gemini/OpenAIÔºâ„Å´ÈÄÅ‰ø°„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Éó„É©„Ç§„Éê„Ç∑„Éº„ÇÑÊ©üÂØÜÊÉÖÂ†±„ÅÆÂèñ„ÇäÊâ±„ÅÑ„Å´„ÅîÊ≥®ÊÑè„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ

- ÁîüÊàê„Åï„Çå„Çãalt„ÉÜ„Ç≠„Çπ„Éà„ÅØAI„Å´„Çà„ÇãËá™ÂãïÁîüÊàê„ÅÆ„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅÊúÄÁµÇÁöÑ„Å™ÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÅØ„ÅîËá™Ë∫´„Åß„ÅîÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ


---


## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1‚Äì5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "„ÄÅ" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "Êó•Êú¨Ë™û | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "„ÄÅ" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "Êó•Êú¨Ë™û | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

plugins.name: SuperLayer (copy)
plugins.description:
SuperLayer (copy) lets you quickly view and copy the names of selected layers in your Figma file or FigJam board. It‚Äôs ideal for generating UI inventories, documentation, or simply organizing your layer structure. The plugin also shows each layer‚Äôs type and a thumbnail preview when available.


To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.
plugins.tagline: Copy Figma and FigJam layer names with ease. Sortable and perfect for docs, audits, and checklists

plugins.name: Screenshot to 100%
plugins.description:
The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.


On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.

plugins.name: MoroccanMock
plugins.description:
Design layouts more efficiently by pulling text strings, images, and cultural assets from a unique Moroccan-inspired palette. "moroccanMock" lets you create custom Moroccan-themed content and share it with other Figma users. Collaboration has never been easier!


Content:

Browse or search content to find a collection of Moroccan-inspired text strings, images, and icons. Struggling to find the perfect content? You can create your own text and image assets by using Add.


Add:

Create text categories and populate them with your own text strings. You can also upload up to 20 PNGs or JPEGs to create image content. As a creator, you may choose to share it publicly or keep it private. When you create content, it is automatically pinned to the Home Screen for quick access (signed-in users only).


Customize Your Home Screen:

Optimize your workflow by pinning the content that you use most to your home screen. Apply 1-click access to any content type with the switch of a toggle (signed-in users only). Drag and drop items on your home screen to suit your preferences.


How to use moroccanMock:

Find content:

Access saved content from your Home Screen or navigate through the tabs to search or browse content. Pin it for ease of access to your home screen.


Applying text content:

Select one or more text layers in your design to apply strings individually or apply them all. Use the original order provided or choose an order from the drop-down menu.


Applying image content:

Select one or more image layers or frames in your design, then apply the images individually or apply them all in random order.


Applying icon content:

Browse the collection or use the search bar to find a Moroccan icon. Click on the icon or drag and drop it into your design. You can also adjust the icon size to scale as needed.


Creating text and image content:

Navigate to the Add tab, click Add, and select content type. Provide a Title relevant to your content. Set your content to Public or Private. See the terms and conditions regarding usage and rights.


Anwar Bahou

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/bahouanwar
plugins.tagline: Bring Moroccan Culture to Your Designs ‚Äì Instantly

plugins.name: Amplifi for Figma
plugins.description:
Quickly assess how intelligible and understandable your text is from directly within the Figma app. The Amplifi Intelligibility Score is our proprietary score that combines a wide range of intelligibility metrics. The score takes into consideration what words actually mean and considers how difficult those concepts are to understand. This creates a true assessment of intelligibility risk.


Key features:

  1. Instantly assess intelligibility for content frames and text nodes.
  2. See a detailed breakdown of what is causing complexity within the text.
  3. See the improvement in scoring after making edits and changes to the text.
